#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Communist Party candidate Johan Boyden , Toronto Centre
#Text=Friday , October 5 , 2007
#Text=Johan Boyden is running for the Communist Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Toronto Centre riding .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I live in St Jamestown and think that working people need a real choice in this election – a voice for a new direction that puts people ’s needs ahead of corporate greed .
#Text=I do n’t claim to speak for everyone in the riding .
#Text=For example , Rosedale , where some of the richest Canadians live .
#Text=I ’ll let you in on a secret : the Liberals are going to win this seat hands-down .
#Text=So that is another reason we ’re running here , because voters can cast their ballot what ever way they want .
#Text=And if they want to send the clearest message to curb corporate rule , they can Vote Communist !
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I ’ve worked in grocery stores and been an assistant shop steward .
#Text=I was elected three times to my student union in university and have been on the boards of non-profit community organizations .

#Text=I ’ve been a community organizer and activist for about a decade , organizing campaigns to save public schools , for queer rights , for environmental protection , for peace and for higher minimum wages .
#Text=I ’m a fighter .
#Text=Elect me and you ’ll vote for somebody who is 26 , full of energy , and is going to push back when big business puts on the heat .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=The Communists have the best policy .

#Text=We ’re calling for a C$ 15 dollar minimum wage , community control of police and prisons , to fix the school funding formulae with $ 20 billion , eliminate tuition fees , and to pay for it by raising corporate taxes .
#Text=We ’re a small party with big ideas .
#Text=And at the debates it shows .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Affordable Housing – building 100,000 units of affordable housing ; legislate real rent controls ; roll back rents ; enforce housing standards and by-laws
#Text=Jobs – fair trade , not free trade ; reduce the work week to 32 hours with no loss in pay ; immediate action on the manufacturing jobs crisis ; $ 15 minimum wage
#Text=Education – affordable childcare at $ 7 a day ; fix the funding formulae and phase-out Catholic schools ; eliminate tuition fees
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Progressive tax reform .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=No.
#Text=We need to upload 100 % of the Harris Download and eliminate market value assessment .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=By implementing our program :
#Text=Fair trade , not free trade – protect Canadian jobs and sovereignty
#Text=Say no to the Security and Prosperity Partnership ( SPP )
#Text=Emergency action to save Canadian manufacturing
#Text=Enact a new Auto Pact – foreign investment must require Canadian made parts and assembly
#Text=Build a Canadian car , machine tool industry , ship-building and agricultural implements industry
#Text=Rebuild aging provincial and municipal infrastructure
#Text=Reduce the work week to 32 hours with 40 hours take-home pay
#Text=Restore and expand social programs ; build affordable housing
#Text=Introduce plant closure legislation with teeth
#Text=Ensure environmentally sustainable development
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I strongly support this proposal and our party has been calling for MMP for over 50 years .

#Text=In this riding the Tory , Ms Taylor , is opposed although I have heard some waffling on ‘ philosophical support . ’ I think that the Liberal incumbent Mr. Smitherman ’s support of MMP is questionable at best , since his cabinet imposed a 60 % supermajority on MMP , but he is saying he supports MMP and it is on his flyer – this shows really the strong public support for MMP in Toronto-Centre .
#Text=The Greens and NDP now also advocate for MMP which is good .
#Text=On October 10th , most voters will get a government they did n’t vote for – a McGuinty Liberal Majority .
#Text=That ’s why we need MMP .
#Text=It is more democratic .
#Text=And it also promotes coalitions , which makes it easier to pressure the government .
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=The citizen ’s assembly on electoral reform wast the most beneficial .
#Text=You are running as a candidate for the Communist Party .
#Text=A lot of people say that Communism is a dead idea or fear that a Communist government would implement some sort of repressive dictatorship .
#Text=What do you say to this ?
#Text=I would say read our programme and make your own mind up : www . votecommunist .
#Text=ca
#Text=The misrepresentations and outright lies about the Communists are n’t limited to us – they are slung against any progressive who rocks the boat .
#Text=The Communist Party is unlikely to win any seats in the election .
#Text=Why did you decide to run for a small party rather than be involved with one of the major parties ?
#Text=We have elected three times in the past , and we will elect again – but not this election .
#Text=It depends on the level of struggle .
#Text=If the people are fighting for justice , the thunder of that movement will build the Communist vote as well .
#Text=I work with people of all different political stripes and colours outside of elections .
#Text=But only my party , the Communist Party , fights for peace , sovereignty , jobs , democracy , and socialism .
#Text=That is why I ’m a communist .
